title: OnePlus One Charging Slowly

thread.text:
Hello,
My OnePlus One smartphone is charging rather slowly since a week or so.
If I use my phone while charging, it will go down in percentage! And if the phone is off it still takes really long to gain some percentages. 
I'm was using my stock charging cable and adapter, but the charging cable won't charge at all anymore. I'm now using the stock adapter with multiple charging cables, none of these cables charge the phone like it would a few weeks ago. 
I have this phone for a little less then 2 years now. My question now is: What could be causing this very slow charge? Because the battery of the phone goes down rather quickly now with normal use, but this shouldn't have anything to do with slow charging does it? 
I have tried some stuff I saw in articles online: Cleaned out my port and clear cache partition. I would like to know if the slow charge is caused by a bad battery or a bad USB-port, because I could repair this. Even if the problem is something else, I would greatly appreciate anyone's help!

Welcome to the forums. Sorry you're having a problem. The slow charge could be the battery, two years is about eol for many of them, or possibly the charger has gone bad. I would not think you have a software problem at this point. If you can replace the battery, that would be my first choice as it could stand to be replaced anyway. If that doesn't help, the charger would be the second thing. Your other solutions are good to do anyway 
If you need additional help or have more questions or details to share, please join the site so you can reply in this thread. See this link for instructions on how to join Android Central.

Hey there, I made an account 
It is possible that the problem lays within the charging cable because I'm now using charging cables that are not the original OnePlus cable. This is because my original charging cable broke. 
I have used multiple charging cables already and it seems that they all have another charging current, The highest I can get with a random cable and a third party charger (adapter) is around 650 mAh. I have found that the normal charging current for the Oneplus One is between 800mAh and 1200mAh, and even higher with the screen off. Do you have any tips on this? Could the problem actually be the charging cable/current? Should I try more cables?
Thanks for your reply and help

replies.text: Welcome as a new member! Yes, I think so. We've seen similar problems in the S8 forums. There may be something special with the original cable.

thread.text:
Alright, then I'll try some more chargers and maybe even buy a new one.
One more question, would it help to buy a new battery, to get some better battery life?

I've tried to charge my OPO with other chargers and cables and the results were a lot slower than the original one. So my suggestion is to find a way to check with an original charger and cable to determine if it is the charger or the battery. Of course a new battery will help you but on OPO it is not that easy to be changed.

title: OnePlus One on CM; Cellular data dies during the day, must reboot

thread.text:
I have a beat up OnePlusOne on Ting. At work I am on WiFi. Most days when I leave work the phone fails to get mobile data while I am driving home. I've tried turning airplane mode on and off. I've tried turning cellular data on and off. I've noticed that after driving out of WiFi range that the cellular icon is not indicating 3G or LTE. The only fix I have found is to reboot the phone. This is a once or twice a day problem. Super annoying to be offline when my family might be trying to message me on hangouts or other data-based system. Can't get MMS messages too. I do have a VPN based data management app, NetGuard to keep games and whatnot from eating up cellular data. Disabling that or toggling it has no effect. Most days there are 1-4 hours where I think I'm in contact with my family but I'm not. It almost seems like it happens about once each 24 hours... like a memory leak that is killing a system service. 
OPO is running Android 6.0.1, cyanogen 13.1.2. It is not rooted but I do have the skills to do that. A factory reset is undesirable but not out of the question.

Could this be your phone's way of telling you it's time to upgrade to a shiny new One Plus 5? That being said then your though of a factory reset WOULD be what I would try. YES its a pain in the keyster, BUT it might just fix the issue AND most of your apps and such should be backed up by google.

I've recently hit this exact same problem, also not rooted and running on Cyanogen. Had to boot the phone twice during yesterday to get my data back. I have bought a OP5 recently but won't be using it for a few days.

replies.text: Also, I did a factory reset about a month or so ago (wanted to see if battery life would improve) so I'm not confident this will fix the issue, at least not long term.

thread.text: I have the same problem with my OPO which is with the same OS. I have a friend who had the same problem and actually a factory reset solved the issue for him but I'm still postponing it.

title: Callers can't hear me. Only with loudspeaker on. Oneplus One

thread.text:
Hi,
For a few days now callers cannot hear me in phone calls unless I enable loudspeaker. Testing with my wife we found that I am audible to caller but so very faintly it sounds very far away.
I believe the culprit has something to do with bluetooth. I have been using bluetooth headphones for around 4 months. I have taken phonecalls using the headphones about 4x over this period. I believe after the 4th call it resulted in this effect. I believe that somehow when I now take calls the phone is somehow tricking itself into thinking it has bluetooth headphones connected and is trying to pick up sound from the microphone on the headphones and the reason it works with loudspeaker enabled is this "force disables" the attempt to pick up sound from the headphone microphone somehow.
I have googled this issue many times and gone through many threads trying the different solutions offered. People have been posting since 2012 and earlier about similar issues with a range of different phones. In almost all cases enabling loudspeaker allows people to make calls but the caller cannot hear them without loudspeaker enabled.
https://productforums.google.com/forum/#!topic/Nexus/qJRGKkh4xX0
This thread, the author lists links to multiple other phone threads with same issue including the Oneplus One.
What I have tried:
1) "Ok Google" turn off. This is the most recommended solution. However my "OK google" detection on any screen was already off, so I tried enabling and setting it up and then disabling and had no success.
2) Turn bluetooth off. Or turn bluetooth on and off. Or turn bluetooth off then restart the phone. I tried this but none of these combinations helped.
3) Clean out the microphone. I did this with a small pin, nothing was dislodged. But seeing as calls work using loudspeaker I don't think it is the problem. Also if you shout quite loud into the mic at the bottom of phone the other user can hear you, but ofcourse you don't want to be screaming into a mic just to be heard.
4) Turn loudspeaker on and off a few times with a call active. No result.
5) Install app "SoundAbout". No result.
Phone details:
Oneplus One
Android 6.01
CyanogenMod 13.1.2
Not rooted
What can I try now to troubleshoot and ideally fix this problem?
Thanks

replies.text:
Welcome to Android Central!Speakerphone typically uses the secondary mic (at the top of the phone), which is why people can still hear you on speakerphone, even when the primary mic is having problems.
It's very possible that the primary mic itself is faulty. You may have to bring it to a repair shop to replace that part.

title: OnePlus One: Still Worth It?

thread.text:
Hi. 
My dad is about to start driving for Uber and also needs a new phone. (His 2013 Moto G is hanging on for dear life.) He just needs a phone that he can browse Facebook, take some pics, run the Uber app etc. Would the 1+1 still be a good option for him?
Posted via the Android Central App

It would still be a good fit for what he wants to do.. and certainly a big step up from what he has.
If he can get a good deal on one, then it would be a good buy...
Yes, I think it still worth it. Camera isn't very good by today's standards though.
Yes it is really good.I just bought one for cheap and its on par with flagship's of today, minus a few new features.

The 1+1 has the same specs as my OnePlus X, except for the X having a 5" screen, compared to the 1s 5.5" screen. I am really happy with the X. The SD 801 and 3GB of ram really perform well. It's no Galaxy S7, but it will certainly run facebook, uber and take photos with little issue.

I've had the 1+1 for about 18 months now. It's a good phone and battery is so-so now. If I'm not using the phone much it'll get through the day but usually I have to charge during the day or evening of I've watched video, played a game for a while or did a lot of browsing while commuting (commute is about 45 minutes each way)

I know this is an extremely old thread, and no one looks at this when dealing with Oneplus (check out the oneplus forums), but I've bounced between a PRIV and the OPO. I got a OPO about 2 months after release. I got the PRIV on impulse through AT&T on release. I really like that phone even though it's had its issues, but ever since the OPO has been updated to marshmallow, it's as good of a phone as I've ever used. 
Would I recommend getting one now? Only if you could get it for less that $150 since it is 2 1/2 years old and it's official software is now End of Life. But if will run extremely smooth as is and would be a great phone for the tinkerer looking to get into Custom Roms. 
The perfect phone with me, a Oneplus phone with BlackBerry virtual keyboard and calendar on board.

title: Oneplus One with no OS! Can't enable usb debugging!!! Please HELP!!!

thread.text:
I just got a Oneplus one from a buddy of mine, the bootloader is unlocked and it has twrp. I installed multirom manager from the playstore so that i could install a custom rom as well and it wouldn't finish booting after....suffice it to say after tweaking on it for a bit, now i don't even have an operating system to flash anymore. PLEASE help me understand how i can get it to communicate with my computer so that i can push the proper files into my phone...
PLEASE!?:-

Don't ever play around with your phone if you have no experience....
If you have access to twrp, download the stock COS or Oxygen or CM nightly rom for the device... boot into twrp, connect to your computer you should automatically have mtp access and then transfer the downloaded files onto the root of your storsge, unplug your device and then begin to flash. Before flashing the rom make sure to perform a full wipe/Factory reset... it should be fairly simple process done it many times.

The OPO seems to be a good fit for that criteria. My absolute main desire is for good battery life.
Posted via the Android Central App

I'd recommend checking out the Nexus 5X as an alternative, or the iPhone SE. I can't recommend the OnePlus One to anyone, but depending on a variety of things, the Moto G, Nexus 5X and a few others are going to stand out as low cost winners over both the OnePlus One and S6.

The Nexus 5X is more expensive than the OPO, and as far as I know it's battery life is nothing remarkable. I like the 5X a lot, it just doesn't seem to fit MY needs as much as I'd like. Same goes for the iPhone SE. I'm curious, why do you not recommend the OPO?
Posted via the Android Central App

replies.text:
Well, it is nearly a full two years old at this point. And you can buy phones with better specs (and that aren't even close to their end of life) for not much more $$. And the 1+1 was always kind of a gamble. If you got a good one, you were golden; but if you got one that fell through any number of the quality control cracks that the 1+1 was notorious for for at least the first year of its life, you could end up out of phone and out whatever you ponied up for it.
That said, the one I have still looks good and seems plenty speedy on Cyanogen 13, 801 processor and all. I just never warmed up to it myself, and Oneplus the company eventually seemed more annoying than innovative to me (and they still do). Given that the phone is approaching its 2nd birthday, though, you might get better answers to your questions about it on the Oneplus forums than here.

I have OPO now and thinking about upgrading to something fresh. But still can't find any good alternative. My criteria >=5.5'' screen, no hardware buttons on the front panel (only capacitive - that is why I don't like Oneplus 2). SW close to vanilla Android. Also I don't like software buttons of Nexus phones - since they steal the real estate of your screen. Any advice?

Asus Zenfone 2 is the only one that comes to mind but it's not a flagship. Prior to that it's like the 1st gen droid turbo, I can't think of any modern devices that go capacitive without a physical home button. Most OEMs are all in with hardware buttons including a front fingerprint scanner/home button or software keys. I personally won't buy a device that doesn't use software keys, so it's possible there are devices out there that might work that I just dismiss out of hand.

The OPO had a bunch of quality control issues, has dubious (at best) software and is just well behind other comparable devices from the same period, let alone newer devices. Most midrange devices are better and that's especially true with the Nexus line, where you get better software, better support, much better security and an all around more polished device, even with the 5X. 5X beats the S6 in battery life, it seems to be very similar to the S7 but behind the S7 Edge. If that's not your cup of tea, I guess I'd just recommend taking a look at some more reputable and more recent devices.

thread.text: Get oneplus one its great in 2016 and I just got cm - bacon update today.

I own a One+ since the very beginning and I see no reason at all to change it. It's still very fast, and when I say very fast, I mean it never ever lags no matter what I launch. It has 3GB RAM which is "now" a standard, and 64GB to fill up with movies/pictures/... A great display, very sharp. The reception is very very good. And more important to me, the battery life is awesome: I send lots of text messages during the day, so the phone is on and off and on and off, I surf quite a bit as well, I watch some youtube videos, and I still have more than 30% at the end of the day. And the charging time is quite fast, so...
Really, I see no reason to change now. 
So yes, I would say: not a bad idea to get a One+ even now

Are you sure that GPS is on?And phone is high accuracy mode?

replies.text: Yes Phone is in High accuracy mode and GPS is ON

thread.text:
Try this:
Open the Phone, as if you were going to make a phone call and dial -
*#9090# -- Diagnostic Configuration (*#197328640# if that doesn't work)
Menu, select Key Input, enter Q
Menu, select Key Input, enter 0000
wait for the next menu. (It takes a while.)
UMTS->COMMON->NV REBUILD->NV REBUILD->SYSTEM->PROTOCOL->GPS->IMS
or, if you don't have UMTS:
UE SETTINGS & INFO->SETTING->SYSTEM->NV REBUILD->ALL
Restart the phone.
If the GPS isn't working, no app will work with the data it gets.
Yes Phone is in High accuracy mode and GPS is ON

getting message " Connection problem or invalid MMI Code. "

anyways, if someone knows something please help me

Welcome to the forums. Play services is needed for a lot of things. I believe that is also what confirms your credentials when unlocking the device. I think your best bet right now is to reset the device.
@golfdriver97 how exactly do i do that? + is there any way of not loosing all my files? ty for your answer

Resets in theory don't wipe your personal files, but I always assume they will. However, since you can't open the device to pull the files off, there momst likely isn't a way to back everything up, either.
From 1+One website: If you're having trouble with your OnePlus handset that may be related to software, try performing a full factory reset.Back up all your important files and information, as the process may erase all data.OxygenOS - Power off your device Press and hold volume down + Power button. ( device will boot into recovery mode ) Select Language Select Wipe data and cache > Wipe data and cache and tap Yes Now Reboot system from " Reboot" option.Cyanogen OS - Power off your device Press and hold volume down + Power button. ( device will boot into recovery mode ) Select Wipe data/factory reset > Yes-- delete all user data Select Wipe cache partition ( You'll notice Android bot with erasing... for a second ) Select Reboot system now
ah okay thanks tried that. its still busy. i will come back to you if i know anything more

works now, but i lost all my data:/
is there any way of restoring it?

replies.text: Most likely, no. Once something is deleted in Android, it's gone.

title: Why can't I revieve a call from a withheld number?

thread.text:
Hi,
I'm in the UK on the 3 network and cannot receive a call if someone calls me from a withheld number. My wife works in a call centre and her number never displays, it normally says 'Unknown Caller' but with the oneplus one, it doesn't even connect to the call, the line goes dead if someone tries calling. All other numbers connect fine.
I'm using software version 11.0-XNPH38R Android 4.4.4

replies.text: Go to settings and go down to and select Privacy and then select Backlist and then tap the settings icon on the bottom right of the screen and from there you can select to receive calls from private or unknown numbers.

I didn't know you could do that with this phone, thanks. Learn something every day
Posted via...The One

thread.text: That doesn't sound right at all, I can't think of an instance where someone's number would have to be restricted, but it almost sounds like a setting or preference that was set up when you were having issues with unknown callers or a default value that has to be changed. You may want to check your settings under security, or check your wireless account settings online and see if there is anything there to prevent unknown callers from getting through. I just can't imagine why it wouldn't allow you the option to accept a call from whomever regardless.

I wonder if it might be your provider. I don't know when it went into effect but until recently, here in the U.S., you could send a number code to your provider and it would block Unknown Numbers from getting through without them entering a code to unhide their numbers before the call would go through. Might you have something like this enabled on your service?

title: OnePlus One became unusably slow overnight. Flash memory corrupted?

thread.text:
Hi all!
I have been loving my OnePlus One and tweaking around with it as much as possible, learning the ropes from Apple to Android and I finally settled on CM13 about two months ago. 
The phone was running fine until one day it started getting slower and slower by the minute. By the end of the day, it took me 5 seconds to unlock the screen and 10 seconds to do just about anything else with the phone (open app-drawer, settings, uninstall apps). Interesting thing was, when I booted up let's say Real Racing 3, the game ran just fine, absolutely no slowdown! 
Fixing this phone has been a project of mine for quite some time, but I now feel as if it's a fruitless project. I can't find any suggestions online and am getting desperate 
I have tried;
Complete factory resets multiple times, and a TWRP Data, Cache, Dalvik clean
Installing lightweight ROMs (SlimSaber, OxygenOS)
Using TWRP's Format Data and removing the installed OS, installing CM13 again after that. Absolutely no use.
Filling up all available memory and then emptying it, both manually and thru an App from the Play Store
Installing a clean ROM seemed to help the very first time I did it with OxygenOS, and then the phone slowed down about 10 minutes in. Now the phone is slow no matter what I do.
Any and all input/comments/suggestions are greatly appreciated!!!

Welcome to Android Central! Does this also happen in Safe Mode? To get into Safe Mode, power down, then power back on again normally. As soon as you see the boot logo, press and hold Vol Up and Vol Down until the homescreen appears. It should now be in Safe Mode, which means any 3rd party apps are disabled. Does it still behave sluggishly?

Phone was as sluggish as ever when booted into safe mode, but something really interesting happened. 
I had about 15% battery left when I rebooted into safe mode, and I heard the low battery tritone sound while the marshmallow animation came up (again, choppy as all hell and taking 30 seconds to finish), like, five seconds into the animation. The same happens while typing, I can basically write an entire sentence and then wait 4-5 seconds for the phone to catch up (show the buttonpress animations, output the letters)
It seems like the animations are whats slowing the phone down so much, because otherwise the phone behaves as it should (in applications, booting up, etc.) ?_? Or am I just stupid?

I'm not really sure what's going on. Is it still really sluggish if you go into Developer Options (if available on CM or Oxygen) and turn off animations?
Ultimately, as you wondered in your title, it may be due to corrupt or defective hardware.

I have a oneplus one. Just updated today to dragon fruit 6.0.1. Everything is smooth except for one thing - my lock screen disappeared! I cannot lock my phone!
Posted via the Android Central App

replies.text: It might be a good idea to create a new thread with that question, since it's not directly related to the OP. Thanks!

Thanks! Found the solution though.
Posted via the Android Central App

title: Why isn't my dialer app reading contacts?

thread.text:
I recently updated my Oneplus One to Lollipop (I'd delayed, having read of problems). Now when I key in a phone number to dial out, the dialer says I have no contacts. All my contacts are right there but only in the Contacts app, and in my Gmail app. I could just access from there, but the reverse is a probelm -- the dialer can't identify any of my contacts calling nin either. I've tried going into the Settings in the Contacts app and exporting some -- still apprently I have no contacts! Any ideas how I can get these parts of my phone to communicate? 
I do have all my phone numbers in my Gmail contacts too, but can't see how to sync them with the dialer app.

replies.text:
Welcome to Android Central!
The dialer and the contacts app should be pretty much the same thing. Try booting in to recovery and wiping the partition cache, if that doesn't work try going to the dialer app in your app list and clearing the data from it. That should reset the app and might pull in the info you need when you open it back up.

thread.text: Are the contacts on the phone or the sim?

title: USB Audio out to PC possible?

thread.text: I recall doing this with other phone OSes but don't recall a method to do this with Android. I did some searching but the only results I got for USB audio on Android was that it is now possible with Lollipop to use a USB microphone. Anyone know if I can connect my phone to my PC and stream audio from it through my PC's audio output (to which I have some killer headphones attached)?

This might be a bit late, but the only reliable way I know of that gives you ALL PC audio without having bluetooth is the SoundWire app. It has a trial version, or you can get the full version (linked) for $3.99 on Google Play if you want control over compression and latency. I'd recommend getting that. The audio on my PC had gone kaput a while ago as well, so I've been using this... even for gaming. It works. Keep in mind, though, that it runs over WiFi (not the internet, just through the router), and you will need to install the SoundWire server for it to work. If you hadn't found a fix yet, enjoy!
PS: unfortunately, I'm not allowed to post links yet, so just look up SoundWire on Google Play, and SoundWire server (it'll be on georgielabs.net)

Apologies, misread the post the first time. The best I could find from a search were BubbleUPnP for DLNA/Chromecast on Google Play, AllConnect - Play & Stream, also on Google Play, Plex (Google Play), and AirWire (UPnP/DLNA), also on Google Play. AirWire is the only one that fully advertises itself as a streaming service, and I haven't tested it out. Good luck.

Choices:Simply connect your phone to your pc as a usb storage unit, and get the PC to read and play the files (usually the same cable you use for charging will do this.Invest in a DAC/Amp such as Oppo HA-2 (or one of the Fiio's, or other brands). Connect to your phone's USB port using an OTG (on the go)cable, connect your headphones directly to the DAC (bypass the PC) or use the line out from the DAC to line in of your PC. UAPP or Onkyo HiFI player are the required apps for android for this method.
See http://forums.androidcentral.com/sam...-note-pro.html
and Enable USB audio on any Android 4.0 smartphone/tablet - AVS Forum | Home Theater Discussions And Reviews
andThe ins and outs of Android USB audio - APC
For more type in "USB Audio on android" into Google, or type the same into the search button in this thread

title: Why can't I be added to a group chat on an iPhone?

thread.text:
So a lot of my friends have an iPhone, and they have **an existing** group chat for us. Only problem is, they can't add me to the group chat, because "This number is not registered with iMessage." When they try to add me, my contact shows up in red and they can't add me.
However, when they **create** a group chat, they can add me, and everything works fine.
I'm using the Hangouts app on my OnePlus One, running Android 5.1.1. Group Chats, and NMS is enabled.
Any possible reason/fix for this? Is this on my side or the iPhones'?

It their existing group chat is comprised purely of iPhones, then they're not using 'normal' text messaging, they're using iMessage (just like using Hangouts, Facebook Messenger, Whatsapp, etc.). Since the group is already created, when they try to add your number, a non iMessage user, it shows up as red. 
If they create a new one, when they add your number it tells the group to use MMS instead of iMessage because there's a non-iMessage user in the group.

replies.text: Thanks! Probably not the best place to ask, but do you know if there is any way for them to switch over to MMS group messaging so that non-iPhones can join?

thread.text: I'm not sure there is, but most likely they'd have to start another group with the same members but the non-iPhone user added.

The SIM has nothing to do with the GPS. Run GPS Status & Toolbox and see how many satellites it's locking to (green) and how strong the signals are (the bar graph). The GPS antenna connection could be bad, giving you a few weak signals instead of the 7 or 8 strong ones you should be getting. I'm getting 11 green at the moment. (And 1 grey, which means that the satellite is supposed to be there, but the receiver isn't hearing it.)

Most people can see an Android display quite well with the backlighting feature turned off. Move the slider all the way to the left, then try using the device that way. If you can't see it well in that setting, move the slider to the right only as far as necessary to view the display comfortably. Alternatively, Auto brightness coupled with power saving mode (found on most Samsung, LG, Sony, and some Motorola devices Brightness) will conservatively adjust the display to the surroundings to only the brightness necessary.

title: I lost a lot of files and want to recover them, how can I do this?

thread.text: Ok so, today, I decided to backup my pictures so I just took my phone, a Oneplus One, and connected it as a camera (PTP) and copy/pasted my dcim folder. Sadly, when it started, my computer kinda bugged and i had to click cancel on the transfer. Next thing i know, everything in my internal storage is gone. This was my first try at backuping my pictures, as I though google drive did it automatically, but I forgot to actually turn the option on on drive so right now, i just lost 6 months worth of pictures, including pictures of my last trip so I am really sad/mad right now. Since the oneplus one does not have a removable storage and the only options to access the storage are MTP and PTP so I cannot run any recovery software for window and since the device was not rooted, every app i tried (things like wondershare Dr. fone) dont work. Is there any way to like, root the device without loosing anything so that i could run thoses apps or do any of you know an other solution to this problem?

Welcome to Android Central! Unfortunately, rooting the device means writing onto memory, which means you'd probably not be able to recover at least some of the photos. See this guide: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...ted-files.html
In the future, set the phone to connect via MTP, and use Windows Explorer to explore the device. Drag and drop the photo files (not the folder itself) from /DCIM/Camera to the computer's hard drive.

File recovery utilities such as Recuva intended for Windows files are worthless on iOS or Android mobile devices. There are some apps like DiskDigger, Easeus, Android Recovery, etc that could possibly help. However, they require rooting the phone. Also, the more the phone has been used since deleting files, the poorer the chances of recovery. That's because the chances of the old data - which is actually still there, not erased, but more like marked for deletion - being overwritten increase with use. Then the data really is gone. And rooting itself might overwrite your lost data.
Anyway, if the data has not been overwritten and if you're willing to root the phone and if you're willing to buy the software, then maybe you can recover some of the files.
From now on, remember - backups, backups, backups!

title: Customer Service Help

thread.text:
Hey Guys!
Since the 1st of September i have been talking to one plus's customer support. To date i have spoken to Gretal, Sheira, Marty, Cyd, jiki, Lejeal, Mark, Lyndon, Rose and Leo, That is right, 10 different customer service people. Almost every time i replied to a message, i would get a responce from a different person. This made the whole situation difficult as they would not know the situation and i would need to reexplain my self, only to need to do it for the next person, and the next. 
After receiving two different emails diagnosing my issue as a different thing, i have decided that if they are not going to give me a refund or fix my phone (Which i am entitled to according to there warranty policy", i am going to prevent them doing this to others by helping in stoping others buying this phone and slowing sales. On October the 12th, at 06:36am i received an email from Sheira who diagnosed my issue as a result of quote "wear and tear via normal daily use" whereas on October the 5th, at 04:27am i received an email diagnosing my issue as quote "misuse/accident" from Cyd.
I guess you guys are wondering what the whole issue was. When you open the sim drawer to insert or remove a sim, you expect it to be a simple and easy task when done carefully. Well, the first time i went to remove the sim card, i had a totally different experience. When going to remove the sim, the sim drawer became stuck. This was as a result of two pins in the sim reader protruding downward, ultimately causing them to become detached when the sim draw was removed. Obviously this is damage is as a result of faulty internal hardware, something that i was accused of creating through "damaging" my phone. May i say that my phone has had a case on it its whole life as well as a tempered glass screen protector. 
After becoming increasingly frustrated at the idiotic robotic replies i was receiving a sent the below email which was replied to with sarcastic comments, accusations and just generally unprofessional comments. I know my email was very hard going but after essentially being robbed of $350 USD you cant complain.
I need assistance in taking my case further and either receiving a refund, replacing the phone or repairing it! Unfortunately, a paypal dispute is out of the option as i am out of the 6month time limit. If any of you guys/girls have had a similar experience, please pm me about it and how you got through the situation. The warranty expires early next month so i have a feeling they are delaying my case so they can give me a reason not to help.
At this point in time, due to the poor customer service i do not recommend anyone buy this phone. Don't get me wrong, it is a bloody amazing phone, but when it lasts for five months and the customer service is terrible, it is defiantly not worth the risk. Hold off until the company works itself out!
Thanks for reading,
I would much appreciate any help possible,
Harris Pisani

title: Why isn't my OnePlus-One phone charging fully to 100?

thread.text: just got my phone last wednesday. its a great phone but realized it wouldnt charge past 97% at all...anyone have this happen to them or have a fix? contacted oneplus but itll be days before i hear from them.

replies.text:
Unplug, restart, and look at your battery % - I had a phone once that would get to 100%, but wouldn't register.
Edit: do this when you're sure it should be at 100%.

thread.text:
I noticed something similar. I got my phone on Friday last week. I unplug it, use it for a few minutes and plug it back in and it will go to 100%. I will say that the battery life has been very good so far.
Posted via the Android Central App

got a response from them...
Thanks for reaching out. This is a common issue with all LiPo batteries, don't worry. I would suggest power cycling your phone three times. Just follow these steps:
1. Let your OnePlus One completely run out of power, until it shuts down.
2. Plug in your OnePlus One to charge continuously, uninterrupted for at least 6 hours.
3. Repeat step 1 and step 2 for three consecutive charge cycles and your OnePlus One should reach 100% when fully charged.
One final suggestion, it might be best to do step 2 overnight to conveniently allow your phone to charge completely uninterrupted.
thanks for sharing  justo11
So is this the kind of battery where it is best to let run completely dry before charging?

replies.text:
Absolutely not. I've heard of issues doing that. ANY phone that 
doesn't have a removable battery, you don't want to let it hit 0%
Posted via...The One

thread.text:
Did the steps from OPO work for anyone?
Posted via the Android Central App

The OnePlus One has a removable battery - in any other possible situation there is an extremely slim chance you are correct. These batteries build memory just like any other rechargeable. By cycling it through once or twice you demonstrate to the battery and circuitry what is dead, and what is fully charged. Doing this repeatedly will reduce overall battery life, but twice through will make an unnoticeable difference in battery life.

title: Exclamation mark near WiFi symbol causes internet connection errors,what do I do?

thread.text: I have a Oneplus One mobile phone which I recently updated to Android lollipop 5.0 via download from Oneplus forums and now I cannot access the internet from my home WiFi. I am able to connect to it but there is an exclamation mark near the WiFi symbol on my phone and when I try to load a web page, it says "This web page is not available". I have tried turning on and off the WiFi on my phone and the router, disconnecting and reconnecting router cables, forgetting network and reconnecting and restarting my phone. I am able to connect to the internet through the WiFi of other places like my friend's house or public WiFis or personal hotspots but not of my home WiFi. I think there is a problem with the router but I am still able to connect to it and access the internet through my laptop. Can anybody help and tell me what to do?

Welcome to Android Central! Try modifying the router's security settings. Ideally, it should be WPA2-PSK/AES, but if that's what you have already, you could try changing it to TKIP or even WEP. Or temporarily turn off the security, to see if that's the problem in the first place (but don't leave it off permanently). See this guide for more ideas: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...-problems.html

title: Shocked how much I like this phone

thread.text:
I loved my old Nexus 5(except for battery life), have had a number of phones over the past 2 years, included G3, Note4, G4. One of the most important things has been battery life, and to be honest, missed the stock nexus feel.
I got a used OPO off swappa and give a shot instead of my G4 and find for ME, the OPO is a better phone(so far). Battery is amazing, love CM12s so far. Yes the camera is nowhere near as good as the G4 or Note 4, but I'm ok with it. The other attributes of the OPO outweigh the camera. For a last year spec phone its smoother and more responsive than most of not all of the phones I have used.
I may feel differently if the new Nexus addresses size, battery and camera, but for now, the price of OPO(yes I know One Plus 2 is about to come out) is pretty darn nice.

I just got a One Plus from here about a week ago cause my S6 edge pissed me off so much. I can honestly say that I love this phone. Battery life is great and no issues unlike my edge. I sold the edge and will be using the One Plus as my daily driver for the foreseeable future,its that good

title: Rate the One Plus One

thread.text: Is the One Plus One a great phone, or a "great phone for the price?" I currently have the Note 4 and I'm thinking of picking up a second phone, just for something different. My last several phones have been HTC or Samsung. I'm thinking about this one, the Nexus 6 or possibly the LG G3 or G4. If I really like both phones, I'll keep them both. If I don't I'll probably just keep the one I like best and sell the other. I thought about the Galaxy S6, but I'm just kind of tired of Samsung right now. What are your thoughts?

replies.text:
I think it's both tbh. It's a solid performer in its own right (nothing spectacular, just solid), and a value considering the price. The OnePlus would make a great backup phone...So would the others you mentioned of course, but you're gonna spend more money acquiring them (with the exception of the G3).
Posted via my Bloat-Free, AT&T G3 running CM12 or my Ascend Mate 7

For me it's an awesome phone. I switch between the OnePlus and the LG G3. The call quality is awesome, it gives me an equalizer when I open Google Music, it's easy to unlock the bootloader to change rom's(Oxygen OS right now), I can use the ColorOs camera apk that gives you a huge upgrade on picture quality with the different plugins options. And the sandstone back is the best feeling I've ever had with a phone and you can never go wrong with 64 gbs of internal storage. The phone never lags, freezes, reboots or any of that other crazy stuff. I've had 4 of them and have yet to have an issue.

thread.text: Thanks. I've been reading and watching reviews of the OnePlus, and I find it distracting to have to try and filter through all the "for the price" bs. In other words, how wouild it compare to the others if it were the same price? At this point, I'm not that concerned about price, but more in performance, speed, lag and battery performance.

replies.text:
Best performing phone I've had. I came from Moto X (2nd Gen) to The One. Phone is even faster and more buttery with Oxygen on it.
Posted via the Android Central App

The oppo is a very good phone. Not earth shatteringly good, but good. I think it would hold up fairly well against most of those devices for most usage, but thats a personal assessment, and it stems from the fact I dont really game on my phone or use it for photos much....YMMV in other words.
Posted via my Bloat-Free, AT&T G3 running CM12 or my Ascend Mate 7

thread.text:
I don't game either. Mainly looking for a good solid fast and dependable phone that just works.
Posted via the Android Central App

replies.text:
Then id say go for it! Another option would be a gently used nexus 5 which should be easy to find on swappa. I am also selling my G3 if you're interested in that, since it was on your original list of potentials. PM me if you want some more info on it. Cheers!
Posted via my Bloat-Free, AT&T G3 running CM12 or my Ascend Mate 7

I haven't used a lot of Android phones, but my OPO performs better than my last one, which was an S4. I'm running CM12s and I haven't tried Oxygen. I've had no stability issues, i.e., freezes, force closes, etc. The OS is admirably free of bloat, although I guess if you want the really stripped-down experience Oxygen is the way to go.
The most obvious place where corners have been cut is the camera, which lacks optical image stabiliation. The CM camera app is nothing special, but there are alternatives. Specifically, the ColorOS camera app is quite good. I'm satisfied with the camera performance with the ColorOS app, but I suppose if you need a best in class camera you should look elsewhere.
The sound quality through the speakers is okay, but not as good as my BlackBerry Passport. Again, if this is a priority you should get something else.

title: AT&T LTE not working for Oneplus One?

thread.text:
Hi all, first time poster here. Hope this thread can provide more information regarding this issue.
I have had my Oneplus One on AT&T for several days now and have tried everything but am still only able to get "H+" for data. I'm in the NYC area, on the mobile share value plan. I'm coming from an HTC EVO 4G LTE on Ting (Spring MNVO). Here is what i've tried:
-Updating/changing APN settings
-Called AT&T tech support three times and went to physical tech support store. All of them could not help me, and told me they couldn't guarantee 4G LTE service for unlocked phones. So they basically told me there's nothing they can do for me.
-I had the tech support register a new SIM card on one of their AT&T approved LTE phones, then put into my Oneplus One. No luck, still H+
-My only option left to try, is to use one of the store's display model IMEI's... which i do have. But before i do that... i wanted to know what your thoughts were.
-My SIM card does have LTE if its inserted into an AT&T approved LTE device. So i'm starting to think its the phone itself.
-I'm getting approximately 8-9Mbps download
At this point, even the H+ data speeds are faster than what i had over at Sprint. But if i'm paying for this service i shouldn't have to settle. Would appreciate any help, thank you!
**By the way. When i type in the *#*#4649#*#* and go to Phone Info. Under "Network Type", i see HSPA+

replies.text:
Its a simple fix...At&t has given you the wrong SIM card for your phone. Go back to another store, preferably with "Android" competent clerks. Ask to try a SIM from a Note 2. Or even better find someone with a note and stick their SIM card in and try it. I had the exact same problem with mine. They gave me an LG Sim which didn't work. (With LTE) There are other SIM cards that can do it as well, I have seen where iphone SIM's work as well. The Samsung Note 2 SIM or equivalent is the one I am using.
I found a store with a tech with a Note 2, he stuck his SIM card in...Instant LTE. Its not the Bands, its At&t incompetence. You can thank me later... With the right SIM APN settings will automatically set themselves.

thread.text: Check the frequencies the phone is capable of against the frequencies AT&T uses for LTE. The phone is missing the 1700 MHz and 1900 MHz bands. If that's what AT&T is using for LTE at that spot, you won't get it. However, HSPA is 42.2 mbps down/5.76 mbps up, and the internet is only about 2mbps, so unless you're downloading more than 21 files at a time, and have great paths to each one, you'll never notice the lack of speed. Maybe in 10 years it'll make a difference, but by then the OnePlus One will probably be seen on Craig's List for $30, and 4G LTE will seem like dial-up does to us now.

replies.text:
You mean HSPA+....and unfortunately At&t doesn't do MIMO(Multiple input multiple output)Though they claim they will...T-Mo does. The theoretical speeds for HSPA+ are actually much higher than 42Mbps. The practical speeds tho, on AT&t (East coast) do not come anywhere close to those. LTE on At&t does approach and go beyond those speeds. If you have to download podcasts(ie: Android central  ) or any other sizable file you'll want LTE.
Also you might rethink saying internet speeds are only 2 Mbps. Even if you meant to say 2 MBps (b is bits, B is Bytes) Netflix streams at HD far beyond that(25MBps). Thats just one example. My LTE on At&t can stream Netflix as fast as my 35/35 Fios connection. Many of us have the At&t 30Gb or more shared plans and use a lot of Data a month. So speed or LTE becomes very important.

thread.text: Hmm i will have to ask AT&T that. I feel its BS though if i'm paying full price for 80% of the service. Maybe i'll switch over to T-mobile eventually. Would this be the case if i used Cricket Wireless? I know they're under AT&T, but im wondering if their LTE signal is different?

replies.text: Cricket caps LTE speeds at 8 MB down. For hspa+ it's capped at 4 MB down. It sounds like AT&T didn't provision the phone for LTE. You may just need to call and ask them to do that until someone actually does. Otherwise, switch to Cricket and save a ton of money.

thread.text:

I seem to remember LTE being added in one of the updates. I.e. the letters LTE in the display. Are you getting LTE speeds?

title: Tried rooting but didn't work!!! What should I do?

thread.text:
i was trying to root my OPO. This is because when i updated to CM12 is wiped my phone including certain apps, including the play store. after searching on youtube, it seemed as though the only solution was rooting... 
so i followed a youtube video and it downloaded SuperSU (just like in the video), but it says there is no SU binary installed. 
before i tried rooting i did try downloading the play store apk from the internet but this didnt work as a message kept on popping up about google play services, and the app would crash.
this is also my first time rooting, im a noob

SuperSU is what controlls su (not SU, there's a difference in Linux). Rooting is installing the su binary, you can't root by installing SuperSU.
(The problem is that in order to install the binary you already have to be rooted, so rooting consists of finding an exploit [a bug] in the particular ROM and using it to obtain root just long enough to install the su binary file. Once that's done, the only reason for an app like SuperSU is to keep viruses from obtaining root. (In Linux, every time you run su, you have to enter the root password. In Android, the app just calls su to give it root permissions. If there's a superuser app installed, like SuperSU, su asks the app if the app asking for root permission is allowed to have it. The superuser app assks you and remembers your choice.)
So ...
IIRC, there's a GAPPS package for CM, that will give you the Play Store and all the other Google apps, and you don't need to be rooted to install it.
And you'll have to find a root exploit for CM12 for the OPO - not every exploit works on every ROM on every phone. (The person who comes up with that will be wealthy in a few weeks. - just charge $10 for the app, program, or whatever, and find a bank with a large enough vault.)

replies.text:
You should get CM12 at an ota update. CM12 should have essentially the same features you enjoy with 11. It will be updated to lollipop with material design baked in. 
Oxygen, on the other hand, is a much lighter ROM. It closely resembles stock Android like one would find on a Nexus device. 
If you like to customize everything with the theme app on your phone, you'll want to stick with CM12. If you want a stock feel without a lot of unneeded extra "features", Oxygen is a great fit.

replies.text:
I have an N5 and a One + I gave to my wife. The One+ is better in every category, than my N5. Except for Qi charging. So battery life, camera, 4K vids, bigger screen, storage, RAM, etc.
Its just a better less expensive N5. Google Now works the same(You just have to install it). Its not good enough for me to get another one, as long as my N5 is working...but if something happened to my N5, I would replace it with a 64GB One+. 
Its very customizable out of the box, with themes, its has knock to wake/sleep. The rest of the "extra features" can be had by installing C11 on the N5. Its has extra settings, which I don't care about, I would list them but its kinda tedious, to go through and list all the differences. Basically its a Super charged Lollipop ROM.
I filled out a One+ survey this morning and will get an invite from it. If you can wait I'll be glad to pass it on to you. Be aware the invites expire fast, so you'll need to use it quick.

Thank you very much, I appreciate it. 
Do you need my email address?

thread.text: My friend uses a OnePlusOne and he told me about lots of good things. You get a near-stock experience (Cyanogenmod 11S) and you can tweak as you like. The screen also has good viewing angles. The battery life is average and the camera is fine but panoramas aren't too good. If you don't care too much about the camera, then it's a good idea.
OnePlus One is totally awesome, very well crafted. I'm thinking of getting one too, but budget is not enough
Have to decide between the Nexus 6 and the Oneplus One. This time I want a good camera, maybe I will wait the upcoming HTC One.

You can use Google Now the same as on your Nexus 5. 
Battery life is very good. I would not call it average. You will get at least twice what you have now. I had a Moto X 2013 and would get home with 20 to 30% most days. Now I get home with around 60 to 70% most days. 
I don’t use cameras too much but it does the job as well as any I have had.
This phone is still a great buy for the money. Cyanogen has a lot to offer past the normal Android stuff. I believe I may have to root any future phones and put Cyanogenmod on them. It has features I am not willing to give up for new hardware.

title: Why isn't my Oneplus One wifi connecting?

thread.text:
My OPO wifi was working fine. But after the Cynogen update, it has stopped working totally. Now it just shows status as - "Connecting" but never connects, even after rebooting it several times and toggling between the Airplane mode.
Someone please suggest a fix for this, its damn irritating
My wifi does not connect too. It keeps saying connecting.............................................
Welcome to Android Central! Review this guide: http://forums.androidcentral.com/amb...-problems.html
I had that situation occasionally before the latest update. My OnePlus One would not reconnect to WiFi if I left a WiFi connection and did not turn it off.
I would turn off WiFi and back on and the connection would reestablish. One time I had to disabled and reinstalled the WiFi source.

Guys! Problem Solved.
Just change the IP address of your Mobile & it will be solved.

replies.text: Can you elaborate on that?

thread.text: B. Daddy all you have to do is go to the preferred Wifi network showing on your mobile and change the IP Settings to 'Static'. Now go to the settings of your Wifi network provider (on a System) & check the IP address they are using. Insert the same IP address in your mobile & save the settings. You are done. (Y)

title: One Plus - Worth Getting?

thread.text:
Hey everybody,
I've been looking to upgrade my phone ( iPhone 5s ) for a while, and I've been thinking about giving Android a shot for a while. Given the off-contract price and customization possibilities, the One Plus seems pretty cool. title: Boot animation doesn't work on my One Plus One, how can I fix this?

thread.text:
So i just made my own boot animation using Adobe Flash CS6.
I exported the part0 and part1 animation to .png files going from 00001 to 00164.
part0 containt 00001 to 00126 and part2 contains 00126 to 00164
My desc.txt containts the width, height. fps and the information
p 1 0 part0
p 0 0 part1
When i go to Themes on my phone i can see the boot animation preview.
But when i restart my phone it just shows me an image with One plus one logo and 
powered by android
Someone knows how i can fix this?

So i finally figured out what was wrong.
First off all if the folder part 0 has images from 0000 to 0122 in there then part1 has to start with 0123 and up.
Second of all if you make Your animation in Flash / Photoshop or other boot animation maker then make sure
That you have selected 32 BIT and RGB colors because when you use 16/8 bit the boot animation wont work.

That's not how you treat your customers. I'm saying goodbye to the OPO. Hello Galaxy S6.

Personally, I'm not that interested in the CM12s update. I haven't heard about any new killer feature in Lollipop to make me get excited. 11s is working just fine for me, so if it takes 6 more months to push out 12s, I'm okay with that. Sure, there are occasional glitches with 11s, but that's going to be the case anyway. These things are never bug-free.
As a BlackBerry user, I got used to installing the latest leaked OS as soon as it came out, but that was because the OS is still new and there were (and are) features that everybody was waiting for. That's not the case with CM-Android. The OS is very mature and feature-rich now.
In all software development, ETA "promises" are little more than guesses, because it's impossible, in principle, to know what problems will surface along the way. Consequently, I don't care what Cyanogen said about releasing 12s within 90 days of Lollipop's launch. As far as I'm concerned, all that is just marketing hype.

Having said that...The OTA came today and I had some time to kill, so I grabbed it. 
So far, nothing exciting to report. A few cosmetic changes. I realize a lot has changed under the hood, but from an end user perspective it's much the same. I think that's a good thing.

I actually think I'll be going back to 11S. I did a clean install using fastboot of the update, wiped it and started fresh, and I am having just a bit too many issues. The two main ones for me is I find performance a bit (some things are fine but in other areas, things just lag... much more so than Oxygen) and I am having touchscreen issues (I really have to touch and hold an icon for it to do anything as a tap isn't working anymore). 
I've reinstalled twice and the same thing.
There are some other things like wonky behaviour (adding apps to the home screen seems to put adjacent app icons into a seizure), missing features that I liked in 11S (better quick settings options, auto brightness fine tuning), and random crashes with the settings app. I could live with them but I could also just wait for the first maintenance update and go back to 11S in the meantime.
I will say 12 gives you more customization features than Oxygen though which I quite like. Oddly enough though Oxygen seemed a bit more stable and definitely snappier.

Thought I'd share this for what its worth. I flashed TWRP and played around with the 11s for awhile, then updated to OxygenOS and honestly was NOT impressed at all. I flashed MultiROM and (just in the past week) downloaded 6 of the top-rated Lollipop ROMs available, starting with CM12 nightlys, then switching to Euphoria, Exodus, Slimpop and Liquidsmooth. They got better (respectively) but being a risk taker, I decided to push the envelope and am so glad I did. I'm currently using Blisspop 5.1 (official) as my primary rom and I must say, it is incredible. I spent about a day with each and IMHO this is the best ROM available and is very, very stable. Unbelievably customizable and performs nicely with no bugs of lags. I know I'm off topic and a long winded but I had to share my experience and hopefully save 'someone' some time and energy, so you can get the most out of this phenomenal device. Just follow the install advise carefully and you won't have a problem, flashing recovery was the hardest part. Anyway, that's it, so enjoy people.

I don't get the update fever. I buy a phone for what it is then, not some stupid update in the future. As it is, I'm having screen dimming issues now I didn't have before the update. I don't care about nor need updates. I'm just glad it didn't completely kill my phone.

replies.text: Fixed! All I had to do was turn off adaptive brightness. Whew that's a relief.

I'm so in the habit of installing leaked OSes from BlackBerry (still doing it!); it's a tough habit to break. But in the BlackBerry case, there have been a number of significant features that we've been waiting for.
It's still true that anyone who hasn't updated shouldn't feel they're missing out on much.
I do like the new icons, very pretty. And I fixed the screen dimming - it was just the adaptive brightness.

thread.text:
Granted where you live and work changes what is the best network. LTE speed wise T-Mobile is the fastest today for the average smartphone but Verizon in some areas with a few new smartphones is faster than T-Mobile. THIS IS TODAY...OpenSignals crowdsourced testing ranks T-Mobiles LTE the fastest in the U.S.
Eventually T-Mo will field a network capable of supporting a theoretical 150 Mbps connection.
As T-Mobile CTO Neville Ray refarms more 3G spectrum for LTE, he will be able to boost many of its 10 MHz systems to a full 20 MHz, but the real prize comes after it closes its acquisition of MetroPCS (which at this point seems almost a given). Surgically adding Metros AWS spectrum to the current network will give it 40 MHz of LTE in some key markets. Thats twice the capacity of the systems currently run by Verizon and AT&T. THIS IS 2015.T-Mobiles new LTE network is fast, but its going to get a lot faster

No need since I'm already on Att and it will work fine with them. And if I were on tmo I would wait for reviews to see how it performs on their network. But who knows if 1+ can sell enough maybe they can make a revision with band 20 lte along with band 2 and 5

title: Can I get some help with my 3 Uk internet/tethering issue with OnePlus One?

thread.text:
Hi
I have never used hotspot on my one plus one, but my network keeps sending me message that you are not allowed to use hotspot on your package plan and they disconnect my internet. it happens every so often, sometimes after every 3 4 minutes sometimes after 3 4 days.
my network is 3 UK and data plan is unlimited.
phone has been rooted and on stock Rom,
PLEASE HELP

Hello. Welcome to Android Central. 
I switched to Three about 8 months ago. I have 200 minutes and unlimited / 1000gb data on a rolling plan (£3 more than a 12 month plan), which includes a 4gb tethering allowance. (they just upped it from 2gb).
I am not rooted. TBH, possibly because I did not set any payment limits, only once did my tethering register on my account. Most times I go well over 4gb tethered, but it shows I have not used any tethering allowance. 
I suspect it's either because you are rooted, your account was not set up correctly, or you are on a plan with no tethering, in which case you should ask to switch. The Three app and your account will show your tethering allowance. 
Pop in to a store, even if you are paying for the phone on contract it shouldn't matter to them if it's been rooted. 
But no, I can't give you a technical explanation. This post has mostly been about my favourite subject - Me. Sorry.

Correction - I didn't read your post properly. Your One Plus One is saying you are tethering when you are not. Unless you can use a tethering app in the UK, and you say you are not, they shouldn't disconnect you. Are you on an old plan without tethering. Does the Three app (above) show tethering. 
I would go to a store rather than 3 support and be patronised on the phone by someone in India who won't listen (in my experience).

thread.text:
First things first, I do not have an invite yet. But, I thought it would be great after seeing so many post about needing invites, to centralize them in one thread. Since this phone is about community and such I figured, let's put all AC members on one thread to give and share invites as they get them. 
I'm sure most everyone here is waiting for one through official means on their website and also trying like mad to get one before Oneplus gets to them. As such, many people will be winning contests and the like and will get their hands on one, only to wait a few more weeks and see more invites in their mailboxes. 
It's a mess over in the official forums to try for invites, crazy fan contests, member numbers, post numbers, drawings....the list goes on and on. If everyone who uses this forum, whether it be lurking, or multiple posts per day, would ban together and share all their current and future invites, then we can have a great community thread there to discuss the phone and less spam in threads for invites. 
Hope this can pan out and get some organization to this forum and end up with a clutter free place to discuss the phone.
Update: I just received and invite from the official forums! Once I get my phone and the invites that will come in a couple weeks I will be sharing here.

Does anyone think that the amount of people begging for an invite is pretty pathetic ?? I understand that the Oneplus is a great phone at an unbeatable price but come on people preserve your dignity begging for the right to buy a phone is pretty pathetic. I believe that it's perfectly reasonable to contribute on the forum but do so in a way that preserves your dignity.
Does anyone think its pretty pathetic how people are groveling at the sight of an invite ??? Just curious

replies.text: For someone who wants to have a good device at a reasonable price, no, I wouldn't say it's pathetic. The device is rumored to go on sale to the masses in October, so it'll be interesting to see how inventory holds up and if there really will be a demand for the device beyond the current invite system that is in place now.

I don't think any user on this forum has come across as pathetic. I actually think that's a pretty harsh statement. It would be easy to say yes, but fact is anyone who has this phone at one point wanted a invite (for the record I was given one 4 weeks ago by saying I was going to get one from oppomart, a member of this forum had an extra one and gave it to me, without me asking). 
Some people I guess can be desperate in their pursuit, but I haven't came across one yet. Some will likely disagree but it is a PRIVILEGE to buy a phone with loaded specs like this for $350. You won't get one from HTC, Samsung or LG for that price with these specs, and they won't make you get "invited" to pay $650 to get a phone either. If someone wants to overpay just because of a brand name, that's their choice, if someone only has $400 to spend and wants the best specs on the market and decides they gotta do whatever they gotta do to to get an invite, then I'm not gonna judge them. OnePlus created this system, blame them. But it feels a little too much like judging someone to say "pathetic "
Posted via...The One

Obsolutely! But they are not the only company that's guilty of creating such marketing gimmick. They probably looked at how people would line up and camp out outside of Apple store just to be able to buy an iPhone. OPPO probably said "hey, if we can only do the same, but we don't have the retail stores". So instead, they hyped up the product a few months before it was released, and created a high demand for it by using an invitation only sale, which made the buyers felt like they're getting something extrat ordinary. When was last time a Chinese phone stirred up such frenzy selling in U.S? Wake up and smell the coffee people! You are buying something that's made in China! A country that's known for making cheap electronics and bad customer support. I mean think about it, there are already people taking about in order for them to make good on the phone's warranty, they need to return the phone back to China for repair. Are you crazy? When was last time you buy a phone that you need to send it back to the country of origin for the warranty repair? Notice only the Chinese companies do this. I mean HTC don't make you send the phone back to Taiwan for repair, or Samsung to Korea etc. It's same old turd that OPPO brilliantly spins around and turn it into gold. Regardless, it's an ingenious marketing scheme. 
Sent from my LG-E980 using Tapatalk
Not on this site, i mean everywhere watch a youtube video about the oneplus or go on their forum it seems like people are begging for an invite.

And I wouldn't even say begging, but more just asking, sometimes fervently. 
But it will be nice if everyone can get one starting October. As for having to return it to China, that's where they have their factories and stock. Why should they waste money on a western office space when stock just has to travel back and forth to China? That would make the phone more expensive too.

I suppose you shouldn't call them "beggers" either. That definition doesn't apply in this case, consider they still have to pay money for it at the end.

We can both agree that the entire oneplus invite system isn't working as ideally as it should.
But oneplus isn't "new" anymore. I shouldn't have to go up and beg them to sell me a phone. Instead, with such a new company, they should go out of their way and encourage me to buy their phone, not jump through hoops for them just to buy one. This is the same debate that's been had over and over. Why you're having it with me like the company pays me is beyond me but okay, here we go:
Personally I think the invite system is working FINE. The only issue is the obvious one from the start: MORE PEOPLE WANT THE PHONE THAN INVITES WERE AVAILABLE. 
Yes, people have moved on to other phones, I'm SURE OnePlus anticipated that. Do you really think their goal was to sell 10,000,000 devices based on invites and match LG and Samsung numbers??? No. The goal was to introduce the device to as many people as they could based on availability and production. If you bothered to click on the link you'd see they said they'd lose more $ on wasted inventory then they would on lost customers. You and many others buying another device or keeping your current device is a price they were willing to pay and I don't blame them. 
They had a business plan, they're sticking to it regardless of what the negative feedback is because like it or not they are a startup and have to take baby steps. Samsung didn't always release 8 phones a year. It took LG years to have a REAL flagship. HTC lost all steam after the HTC EVO 4g in 2010 and didn't get it back until last year with the HTC One M7.
In finish, NO, YOU ABSOLUTELY SHOULD NOT have to ask someone to give them your $, your choices are these: keep your current device and wait for the nexus 6, you'll likely be happy I'm sure, what the specs are and wheather it'll have more than 32 GB of storage and what that battery will be is yet to be seen. Or you can get a current model like the new moto x, the specs are the same as the OPO, the battery is worse at 2300mah, and it's $150 more. You can get a note 4 and pay $800. Whatever you do won't effect me so you don't have to convince me of anything. Whatever you do won't effect OnePlus and their plans going fwd. The company has room for improvement but I got top notch specs for $350, carrier unlocked, android l within 3 months. Awesome display, awesome build. THERE ISN'T A PHONE OUT OR SOON TO BE RELEASED INCLUDING THE NEXUS 6 that will make me regret my choice. I BET we will have android l before any Samsung phone, any HTC phone, any Motorola or LG phone. Our updates don't get filtered through a carrier and cyanogenmod breathes this ****. They don't punch a clock for Samsung or go home at 5:00pm. If you don't have nexus in front of your devices name, we'll get "L" before it. I'm happy

Funny thing is invites are plentiful right now. I got my shareables Saturday and thought "how do I want to give them away"? So I figured since I got my invite from here and pledged to give them away here, I'd give them here, not as an announcement, but by watching, finding someone who maybe wanted a invite but missed out by minutes, whatever. I just want to give my invites to someone who appreciated the bang for the $ this phone offers. As you all know the Nexus 6 was announced today, and while I see it to be a truly wonderful phone, I do not feel the price will fit my budget. I currently own a Nexus 5 and will be passing it down to my younger brother and introduce him to the magic on an unlocked (and rooted) Android phone. I myself am looking for a device with the characteristics of the One Plus One. I feel a phone built by a group of people who believe in customizing an OS as much as I personally do truly is something worth trying and owning.
Story aside, I really would appreciate an invite if one comes available. I'd love to give this phone a try as I feel it meets right in the middle of price point and features I could not fully get from a Nexus device at this time.

I'm running into a problem trying to order. Wondering if anyone else has seen this problem: When trying to check out, it takes me to a page asking for first and last name and email. My email is already entered in but when I enter my name and hit "Save" nothing happens. I can't get past this page. Tried using different browsers as well. 
Anyone else run into this? 
Thanks.

replies.text: I am having the same issue. I can't update my first and last name as well.

Well, glad I'm not alone but bummed someone else is dealing with it. 
Thanks for at least confirming for me that it's not just on my end.

I had the same problem but was able to work around it. Here is what you need to do:
Log in to the oneplus.net page and when you get to the point where clicking the "Save" button does nothing, right click the "Save" button and click "Inspect Element". Scroll up and find the following line:
<div class="page-<div class="my-account">title">
Right click that line and choose "Edit as HTML" and then hit Ctrl-A (or Command-A on Mac) to select all of the html text. Hit Ctrl-C (or Command-C on Mac) to copy the text. Create a new file on your computer (call it something like test.html) and paste the html into that file. Save the file and then open it in the same browser where you logged in to the oneplus.net site. When you open the local file you will see the First Name and Last Name text boxes. Fill them in and hit the Save button. You should then be brought to the next step in the process of ordering.
As crazy as this was, it worked for me last night and allowed me to place my order.

I got an invite from a really nice person on G+, duly ordered and received my OPO and have been using it for around 5 weeks now.
I sold my beloved Nexus 5 and qi charger to pay for half the OPO!
First thing is the first impression I got on receiving it, wow! The packaging is superb, making it feel like a top of the line phone before even setting eyes on it.
Opened it up and placed it in hand, it feels great with the sandstone black backing, although not sure how this will wear over time?
The 2 biggest things in my opinion are the battery life and the ability to completely change the look of the phone using the themes. If I get sick of the icons or notifications etc I just get another theme and hey presto, its a new phone!
With my use, the N5 would need a charge around 7pm to make it last the rest of the night, easy to do with the qi charger.
This OPO though, I can't kill it! With the same use patterns or maybe even more use, as I know now that its not going to run out on me, I'm sitting around 40% when I get to bed. This is a huge benefit in my opinion, when I go away camping I can get the whole weekend using just the phone and a battery pack, and that's usually playing music over my UE mini boom all weekend!
I've not had any of the issues that others have had, for example the yellow bit on the screen. I have been mightily impressed with this phone and can see me using it for a couple of years rather than the normal 1 year with my nexii.
Posted via the Android Central App

I ordered mine this Monday afternoon and it's scheduled to be delivered Friday. It would have been here Thursday if it wasn't Thanksgiving. Receiving it quite a bit faster than I thought I would receive it. Can't wait to see if it will replace my g3?

Ha, too late. Unboxed. 
I am really impressed with this phone. And Cyonogen is fantastic. It's like stock Google "Plus" -- just a touch of extra features that make the user experience better, easier, and more fun. 
Really impressed by the hardware too so far. Camera is so much better than my Nexus 5. Can't wait to pop a SIM in this baby and use this as my daily driver.
Does it feel too big to use for phone calls? I'm still waiting on getting a sim in mine.

Honestly, I'm quite surprised at how one-hand capable the device is. It's not very wide (like say the Nexus 6) so it doesn't feel that difficult to handle. Reaching the top is trickier, but nothing that is unmanageable. Also, you can install a "Drop Down Notification Shade" app and have it be used with the Quick Launch shortcuts (under Settings > Buttons). 
As for actually putting it up to your ear, it doesn't feel bad at all. 
My only wish is that they didn't bother with capacitive buttons (I'm a big fan of on-screen buttons and have been for a long time). I just don't see any added benefit to the capacitive buttons because the screen is so large already and with Immersion mode, the software can already take advantage of the larger screen. So why waste the bezel space for capacitive buttons? They could've gotten rid of it and made the phone slightly less tall. 
Anyway, so far, I'm enjoying my OPO. It's leagues better than my Nexus 5. I'm liking the camera, loud speaker, and screen. Build is great, too. And as I mentioned before, the software feels like stock Android "Plus". I'm running the Google Launcher with Moonshine theme: https://play.google.com/store/apps/d...oonshine&hl=en
